SEARCH
Package com.example.eventease.data

Interface EventRepository

All Known Implementing Classes:
FirebaseEventRepository, FirestoreEventRepository
public interface EventRepository
Repository interface for event data operations. Provides methods to retrieve events, create events, and listen to waitlist count updates. This interface follows the Repository pattern to abstract data access operations.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void>
    create(Event event)
    Creates a new event in the data store.

  • Method Details

    • getOpenEvents

      com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<Event>> getOpenEvents(Date now)
      Retrieves all events that are currently open for registration. An event is considered open if the current time is within its registration period.
      Parameters:
      now - the current date/time to compare against event registration periods
      Returns:
      a Task that completes with a list of open events

    • getEvent

      com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Event> getEvent(String eventId)
      Retrieves a single event by its unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the unique event identifier
      Returns:
      a Task that completes with the Event, or null if not found

    • listenWaitlistCount

      ListenerRegistration listenWaitlistCount(String eventId, WaitlistCountListener l)
      Registers a listener to receive waitlist count updates for a specific event. The listener will be called whenever the waitlist count changes.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the unique event identifier
      l - the listener to receive waitlist count updates
      Returns:
      a ListenerRegistration that can be used to stop listening

    • create

      com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> create(Event event)
      Creates a new event in the data store.
      Parameters:
      event - the event to create (must have a valid ID and organizerId)
      Returns:
      a Task that completes when the event is created
